main event: A white, round, bright object was observed moving at a high speed and making a 90-degree turn over Bagdad, Florida in June 1954. It was observed for approximately 1 hour.
interesting points: The object was described as white, round, and bright, with a shiny silver surface that glowed to a dull red color when passing through clouds.
It was observed moving at a high speed and making a steep climb to approximately 50,000 feet before maneuvering horizontally and vertically at a high rate of speed.
The sighting was reported by a civilian and a general (Lt. USAF, Aviator), providing credibility to the observation.
No unusual meteorological, astronomical, or other conditions were recorded that could account for the sighting.
A preliminary investigation by the 3604th Air Intelligence Division found no record of any aircraft in the area during the reported observation.
sighted object: white, round, bright object with a shiny silver surface
witnesses: Civilian and a general (Lt. USAF, Aviator)
